result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) .11% [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) .11% [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Karen L. Wirth was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for IID Exemptions

Karen L. Wirth, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel. No other appearances. Defendant sworn in on oath and examined by court. Motion by defendant for exemption of vehicles from IID. Court grants motion.

records.addlTxt:
Karen L. Wirth, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Paul A. Ksicinski.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. All other open cases with defendant are dismissed on prosecutor's motion pursuant to plea agreement, traffic cases reopened and dismissed. Defense gives plea questionnaire/waiver of rights to the court, court reviews with the defendant. State gives recommendation, Defense attorney and defendant retire to discuss the matter. Defense is free to argue for another agreement. State recites elements of the offense. Court reviews rights and remainder of plea agreement. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1, counts 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed on state's motion pursuant to plea agreement. Defense counsel makes statement on the defense. Defense and State make closing statements and arguments. Both of the Defendant's daughters are present and wish to make statements. Chesney Wirth sworn in on oath and testifies. Examined by Atty Ksicinski. Other daughter would more or less repeat the first's statement, no futher witnesses. Atty Nolen requests state's recommendation be accepted. Court follows recommendation as regards fine. Placed Defendant on probation for 36 months.Jury trial is cancelled.
from Nicki Golubov to put jury trial back on calendar.

Karen L. Wirth, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Paul A. Ksicinski.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Letter from counsel to DA tendered to court. No jury instructions, not witness list, neccessary filings have not been submitted by the defense. Recess to allow counsel to speak with DA. recess to allow counsel to speak with client. Matter resolved. Defendant to enter pleas on case 16CF46, 16CT26, Traffic cases are to be reopened and dismissed on state's motion, 16CF29 (felony bail jumping) to be scheduled for future date and dismissed pursuant to plea agreement. Other court dates are cancelled, All warrants are vacated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. 2 day jury trial, 40 person panel, 5 strikes, 1 alternate. Final pre-trial 02-02-17, 2:30. Jury Trial 02-15--02-16  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Karen L. Wirth, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Paul A. Ksicinski.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Parties have reviewed compentency report, no revisions or corrections. Information contains additional count. Subject to objections to information, enters plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from Dr. Craig Schoenecker
Hearing on June 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
To Notice Competency

Violations: OWI (4th in 5 years) Possess THC, Possess Drug Paraphernalia
Issuing Agency: Green County Sheriff's Department
Conditions:   May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant. Absolute sobriety while driving. May not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license on a public highway or roadway in the State of Wisconsin.   May not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of Court. Defendant to cooperate with Forensic Unit.

Karen L. Wirth, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Paul A. Ksicinski.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Atty Ksicinski files motion for competency evaluation. Court decides that it would be appropriate. Atty Luhman asks court to find probable cause for competency evaluation. Wisconsin Forensic Unit to take case on an outpatient basis. Defense requests a psychiatrist, State concurrs. Court finds in standard competency order, psychiatrist conduct evaluation.  Bond to be modified.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
